description: Heavy monsoon rains in Munnar triggered a landslide, leading to several reported cases of injuries and displacement.
Continuous downpour in the Wayanad Sanctuary area caused a landslide, affecting wildlife and local infrastructure.
A cyclone made landfall near Kovalam Beach, bringing strong winds and heavy rain, causing coastal damage.
Lack of rainfall led to severe drought conditions in the Silent Valley region, impacting water sources.
An intense heatwave was recorded at Athirappilly Waterfalls, with temperatures soaring and minimal rainfall.
Widespread flooding occurred in the low-lying Kuttanad area due to heavy monsoon rains, leading to a spike in waterborne diseases.
Unprecedented rainfall caused flash floods in Kumarakom, affecting tourism and local communities.
The peripheries of a cyclone brought gusty winds to Illikkal Kallu, though with minimal rainfall.
Unseasonably high temperatures in the hill station of Vagamon were classified as a heatwave, causing discomfort.
A spring heatwave affected the coastal area of Bekal Fort, with higher than average temperatures.
Minor overflow from Neyyar Dam due to a sudden, brief cloudburst resulted in localized flooding downstream.
The remnants of a cyclone system caused strong winds and high tides along Cherai Beach.
Drought conditions worsened in Nelliyampathy Hills as the dry season continued with negligible rain.
A localized flash flood was reported near Illikkal Kallu after a sudden summer shower in the hills.
Extreme heatwave conditions prevailed in Nelliyampathy Hills, posing a risk to local flora and fauna.
A minor landslide occurred at Illikkal Kallu due to soil erosion from previous dry conditions.
Heavy rains caused the backwaters to rise, leading to flooding in parts of Kumarakom.
A small landslide was reported on the access road to Athirappilly Waterfalls following moderate rainfall.
A significant landslide near Athirappilly Waterfalls isolated nearby villages and led to a health crisis.
High humidity combined with high temperatures created heatwave-like conditions in the temple town of Guruvayur.
Despite some rain, a prolonged dry spell led to drought conditions being declared in the Kozhikode region.
A surprising lack of post-monsoon showers resulted in drought affecting agriculture in Kuttanad.
Sudden, intense rainfall led to flash flooding in low-lying areas around Thekkady.
The Gavi forest region experienced drought conditions due to a failed northeast monsoon.
A minor landslide occurred on a cliffside near St. Angelo Fort after unexpected light rains.
Continued lack of rain intensified the drought in Gavi, with water levels in reservoirs dropping critically.
The outer bands of a distant cyclone brought unusually cool and windy weather to Thusharagiri.
A pre-summer heatwave was recorded in Nelliyampathy Hills, affecting coffee and tea plantations.
Drought conditions on Chembra Peak led to the drying up of the heart-shaped lake.
A cyclone alert was issued as strong winds and high waves were reported near Peechi Dam reservoir.
Controlled release of water from Neyyar Dam to prevent overflow caused minor, managed flooding downstream.
A cyclone passing far offshore caused rough seas and coastal erosion at Payyambalam Beach.
A pre-monsoon cyclone brought heavy rain and disrupted houseboat tourism in the Alleppey Backwaters.
Sea erosion, exacerbated by strong waves, caused a minor landslide along the Kozhikode beachside cliffs.
A cyclonic storm system resulted in heavy rainfall and falling trees in the Nilambur Teak Museum area.
Severe waterlogging and flooding paralyzed Fort Kochi after a day of incessant, heavy monsoon rain.
A post-monsoon cyclonic depression caused moderate rain and wind, with minimal damage in Nilambur.
A 'cloud-burst' event led to sudden flash floods in Thekkady, catching residents and tourists by surprise.
Saturated soil from previous rains gave way, causing a landslide on the forest road to Gavi.
Lingering effects of the previous day's rain caused continued flooding in the Periyar river basin near Thekkady.
A small-scale landslide occurred in a Vagamon meadow due to soil instability, with no major impact.
A minor rockfall was reported near Perunthenaruvi Waterfalls, a common occurrence during the late monsoon.
A cyclone warning led to the evacuation of the Kottakunnu amusement park as a precautionary measure.
Unusually warm and dry weather for November was classified as a heatwave in the Nilambur area.
The failure of the northeast monsoon led to the early onset of drought in the Nelliyampathy Hills.
Strong summer winds, part of a distant cyclonic formation, caused minor damage at the Konni Elephant Cage.
The rocky terrain of Jatayu Earth's Center amplified the effects of a regional heatwave.
Severe drought conditions were reported along the coast at Marari Beach, affecting local vegetation.
A flash flood in a mountain stream near Nelliyampathy occurred despite overall drought conditions.
A pre-monsoon heatwave made conditions on Kovalam Beach extremely uncomfortable for tourists.
A minor rockslide near the entrance of Edakkal Caves was reported, caused by weathering.
Despite the onset of monsoon rains, the region was still under a drought declaration from the preceding dry spell.
Heavy catchment rainfall forced the opening of Neyyar Dam spillways, causing downstream flooding.
Severe sea erosion at Kozhikode Beach led to a landslide, threatening coastal properties.
The influence of a cyclone in the Arabian Sea brought heavy winds and rain to the high ranges of Munnar.
A cyclonic circulation caused the Chalakudy River to swell, increasing the force of Athirappilly Waterfalls.
Riverbank erosion in the Kadalundi Bird Sanctuary resulted in a landslide, altering bird habitats.
A post-monsoon heatwave was an unusual event, affecting the backwater ecosystem of Alleppey.
A landslip was reported in the hilly terrain of Vayalada following unexpected late-year rains.
A minor landslide occurred on a hill overlooking the Banasura Sagar Dam reservoir.
A sudden release of water from an upstream dam caused a brief but intense flood at Athirappilly Waterfalls.
The dry winter season led to drought conditions in the Ranipuram Hills, impacting local streams.
A severe heatwave was recorded near Malampuzha Dam, with temperatures well above the seasonal average.
Water levels in Ashtamudi Lake dropped significantly due to prolonged drought and high evaporation rates.
The urban heat island effect in Mattancherry exacerbated a regional heatwave, causing several cases of heatstroke.
Cyclone Amphan brought torrential rain and strong winds to Varkala Beach, causing significant coastal erosion.
The onset of a vigorous monsoon caused severe flooding and waterlogging along the Alappuzha coastline.
Torrential rains in the Idukki Dam catchment area triggered multiple landslides, isolating several communities.
A catastrophic landslide in Kalpetta was caused by unprecedented rainfall, leading to significant loss of life and property.
Urban flooding paralyzed Kottayam Town after several days of continuous, moderate rainfall.
Heavy northeast monsoon rains led to flooding of the Pamba River, affecting the Sabarimala pilgrimage route.
The impact of Cyclone Nivar was felt in Ezhimala with heavy rainfall and rough seas.
A weaker than usual northeast monsoon resulted in early drought conditions in the Kottakkal region.
The port town of Beypore experienced water scarcity as drought conditions persisted through January.
An extreme heatwave significantly reduced the water flow at Vazhachal Waterfalls.
Cyclone Tauktae passed close to the coast, causing flooding and wind damage around Bolgatty Palace.
The Kadalundi River overflowed its banks, flooding the bird sanctuary and surrounding areas.
High-intensity rainfall on saturated ground led to a dangerous landslide in the windy hills of Ramakkalmedu.
Widespread flooding was reported in the agricultural plains around Sulthan Bathery after days of rain.
A landslip on the winding road to the Ponmudi hill station trapped tourists and residents.
Severe drought in the Parambikulam Tiger Reserve led to forest fires and scarcity of water for wildlife.
Thenmala recorded one of its highest ever temperatures during a prolonged and intense heatwave.
The monsoon arrived with force, causing coastal flooding and damage to infrastructure near Bekal Fort.
A series of major landslides occurred across Munnar's tea estates following record-breaking rainfall.
A deep depression in the Bay of Bengal brought extreme rainfall, causing severe floods in Kumarakom.
Drought conditions prevailed in Wayanad, with tourism to Edakkal Caves affected by the extreme dryness.
An exceptional heatwave baked the Silent Valley, posing a threat to its unique and sensitive ecosystem.
A cyclonic storm caused a significant storm surge at Marari Beach, inundating coastal homes.
The historic area of Fort Kochi was completely submerged as heavy monsoon rains coincided with high tides.
A landslide near Thekkady blocked the main road, disrupting the supply chain and stranding tourists.
The Gavi forest region was hit by flash floods after a cloudburst event in the surrounding hills.
Water shortages were reported in Guruvayur as drought conditions intensified in the post-monsoon period.
A record-breaking heatwave made the stone structure of Jatayu Earth's Center dangerously hot.
A powerful cyclone made landfall near Kannur, causing widespread destruction along Muzhappilangad Beach.
Extreme rainfall led to a massive landslide on the slopes of Chembra Peak, reshaping the landscape.
Urban drainage systems failed in Kozhikode, leading to severe flooding throughout the city and beach area.
Heavy monsoon onset caused severe flooding in the low-lying agricultural fields of Kuttanad.
A minor landslide blocked the road to Thekkady following a night of intense rainfall.
The reservoir at Banasura Sagar Dam reached full capacity, necessitating a controlled release that flooded downstream areas.
The Chalakudy river was in spate, causing the Athirappilly waterfalls to become a dangerous torrent.
Slippage of loose soil near Thusharagiri Waterfalls was reported due to continuous rain.
A blistering heatwave gripped the Malampuzha region, causing water levels in the dam to plummet.
Devotees at Guruvayur temple faced extreme heat stress due to an ongoing heatwave.
The brackish water of Ashtamudi Lake saw increased salinity as freshwater inflow ceased due to drought.
The area around Neyyar Dam experienced extreme heat, leading to concerns about water availability.
High temperatures combined with high humidity created oppressive heatwave conditions at Cherai Beach.
A devastating landslide swept through a tea estate in Munnar following days of unprecedented rainfall.
The town of Kalpetta was inundated as all local rivers overflowed their banks simultaneously.
The Chaliyar river flooded Nilambur, with waters entering the premises of the Teak Museum.
Multiple landslides on the routes to Sabarimala made the pilgrimage treacherous.
Kottayam town experienced its worst flood in decades, with many residents requiring rescue.
A pre-monsoon cyclone caused rough seas and heavy rain, leading to evacuations along Payyambalam Beach.
The same cyclonic system brought strong winds that caused damage to temporary structures near Bekal Fort.
The cyclone's impact resulted in severe waterlogging and uprooted trees across Kozhikode city.
Remnants of the cyclone brought gusty winds and moderate rainfall to the Kottakunnu area.
The cyclone caused a storm surge in Kochi's backwaters, flooding historical areas of Fort Kochi.
The peak of the dry season saw Parambikulam facing a severe drought, increasing the risk of forest fires.
Waterholes within the Wayanad Sanctuary dried up, forcing animals to venture out in search of water.
The Periyar Lake in Thekkady shrank to a fraction of its size due to the extended drought.
Drought conditions put a strain on the resources at the Konni Elephant training center.
The Thenmala eco-tourism project was impacted by a severe water crisis caused by the ongoing drought.
Northeast monsoon rains caused severe flooding and cliff erosion at Varkala Beach.
Low-lying areas around the Jatayu Earth's Center were inundated following heavy rainfall.
A landslip near Perunthenaruvi Waterfalls was triggered by the intense downpour.
The meadows of Vagamon became waterlogged, and several minor landslides were reported on the hillsides.
The backwaters swelled to dangerous levels, flooding homes and resorts throughout Alleppey.
The drive-in beach at Muzhappilangad was submerged due to heavy monsoon rains and high tides.
A landslide in the Ranipuram Hills cut off access to the popular trekking spot.
Flash floods were reported in the streams near Edakkal Caves, making the area unsafe for visitors.
The hilly region of Vayalada experienced a significant landslide that damaged agricultural land.
The sanctuary islands in Kadalundi were completely flooded, displacing thousands of birds.
A severe heatwave in Nelliyampathy Hills led to the wilting of tea and orange crops.
The heatwave caused rapid evaporation from the Peechi Dam reservoir, raising concerns about water supply.
The densely populated area of Mattancherry suffered from extreme heat stress during the April heatwave.
The heatwave impacted the fragile ecosystem of the Kumarakom bird sanctuary and backwaters.
Tourists and locals avoided the outdoors as a blistering heatwave made conditions at Marari Beach unbearable.
A late-season cyclone brought unexpectedly heavy rains and strong winds to the Kovalam coast.
The cyclone caused the rivers in Thenmala to swell, leading to flooding in forest and residential areas.
The cyclonic rainfall saturated the hills around Gavi, resulting in a number of dangerous landslides.
Water levels in the Idukki Dam rose sharply due to heavy rainfall from the cyclone, prompting a flood alert.
A landslide was reported on the steep slopes of Illikkal Kallu, triggered by the intense cyclonic rain.
The Vazhachal waterfalls merged with the surrounding forest as the Chalakudy river experienced a major flood.
The island hosting Bolgatty Palace was partially submerged due to extreme monsoon rainfall in Kochi.
A state of emergency was declared in Kuttanad as it faced one of the worst floods in its history.
The entire Vembanad lake ecosystem was disrupted by massive flooding that inundated Kumarakom.
A major landslide occurred near Perunthenaruvi Waterfalls, altering the course of the Pamba river.
The grasslands of Ranipuram Hills turned brown as the region was officially declared drought-hit.
A spring heatwave saw record high temperatures being recorded at the Kottakunnu hilltop park.
Seawater inundated the area around St. Angelo Fort during a period of heavy monsoon rains and high tides.
The shutters of Peechi Dam were opened after heavy September rains, causing controlled flooding.
High velocity winds combined with torrential rain caused a severe landslide at Ramakkalmedu.
A cyclone in the Arabian Sea brought heavy rainfall and landslips to the hill station of Ponmudi.
Trekking to Chembra Peak was temporarily banned due to the high risk of forest fires caused by drought.
The port at Beypore was forced to halt operations as the Chaliyar river flooded the entire area.
A landslide in a quarry near Sulthan Bathery caused significant environmental damage.
Unusually heavy northeast monsoon rains caused Ashtamudi Lake to flood all adjacent towns and villages.
Coastal homes in Cherai were flooded after a sea wall breached during the peak of the monsoon.
The town of Kottakkal, famous for Ayurveda, was severely flooded, disrupting medical services.
The river flowing near the Konni Elephant Cage ran dry due to a prolonged winter drought.
A cyclone caused a massive storm surge, leading to the temporary closure of Alappuzha Beach.
The beautiful meadows of Vagamon were scarred by numerous landslides triggered by relentless rain.
A severe heatwave made exploring the expansive Bekal Fort a difficult and risky activity.
The forest area around Vazhachal was completely flooded, posing a danger to local wildlife.
The entire Bolgatty island was waterlogged after a deep depression brought extreme rainfall to Kochi.
The water level in the Idukki reservoir fell to a new low, raising concerns about power generation.
A major landslide occurred on one of the 'islands' within the Banasura Sagar Dam reservoir.
The triple cascades of Thusharagiri were reduced to a trickle during an intense pre-summer heatwave.
Early northeast monsoon showers caused flash floods along the trekking paths to Sabarimala.
The peak of a summer heatwave saw temperatures at Jatayu Earth's Center reach life-threatening levels.
A cyclone brought strong winds and heavy rain to the naval academy at Ezhimala.
Rivers inside the core zone of Silent Valley National Park were in spate, causing unprecedented flooding.
A severe drought led to the implementation of water rationing in the temple town of Guruvayur.
A cyclone's passage caused strong winds that uprooted several trees in the Vayalada viewpoint area.
The annual monsoon flood in Kuttanad was particularly severe, leading to a major public health crisis.
Late monsoon rains caused the Periyar river to swell, flooding areas around Thekkady.
Multiple small landslides within the Wayanad Sanctuary disrupted animal movement patterns.
Palakkad district recorded its highest temperature of the year near Malampuzha Dam during a brutal heatwave.
A 'Red Alert' was issued for Kottayam as the town was completely submerged by floodwaters.
A minor landslip was reported on the trekking path at Ranipuram Hills after moderate rains.
The agricultural town of Sulthan Bathery faced a severe water crisis due to a failed monsoon.
Continuous rainfall in the catchment area forced authorities to open the Peechi Dam spillway.
An intense heatwave threatened the health of the ancient teak trees in the Nilambur plantation.
Heavy rains at the end of the monsoon season caused a fresh wave of flooding in the Alleppey backwaters.
The flow of Perunthenaruvi Waterfalls was reduced to a bare minimum due to severe drought.
The monsoon's vigorous start led to a rapid increase in the water level of the Idukki reservoir.
The Thenmala region experienced a prolonged heatwave, leading to the cancellation of several eco-tourism activities.
The road to Ponmudi was closed for a week due to multiple landslides caused by the northeast monsoon.
The historic lanes of Fort Kochi baked in a severe heatwave that gripped the central Kerala region.
The distant effects of a cyclone resulted in unusually high tides at Payyambalam Beach.
The area surrounding Bekal Fort experienced severe flooding as the monsoon reached its peak intensity.
The rocky landscape of Illikkal Kallu became extremely dry and arid during the winter drought.
A landslide in Gavi trapped a bus full of tourists, necessitating a major rescue operation.
A punishing heatwave drastically reduced tourism to Athirappilly as the waterfall's flow diminished.
The annual flooding of the Kadalundi Bird Sanctuary was more extensive than usual, affecting nesting sites.
A massive section of a hillside on Chembra Peak collapsed after absorbing over 200mm of rain in a day.
The commercial hub of Mattancherry was brought to a standstill by severe urban flooding.
The Kallada River, which feeds Ashtamudi Lake, overflowed, causing flooding along its banks.
A cyclone's remnant brought strong winds and heavy, unseasonal rain to the high-altitude region of Ramakkalmedu.
The entire stretch of Muzhappilangad drive-in beach was closed as it was completely inundated by monsoon floodwaters.
The prolonged absence of rain led to severe drought conditions, increasing the fire risk in Ranipuram's forests.
A 'once in a century' flood event submerged almost all of Kumarakom, causing widespread devastation.
The area around Edakkal Caves faced an acute water shortage as the region reeled under a severe drought.
The temple town of Guruvayur was heavily flooded, disrupting daily rituals and causing hardship for pilgrims.
